Legal_Issue: Whether the RPD erred in failing to address key evidence on state protection for domestic violence victims
Application_Facts: Maria Elena Solis Castillo claimed refugee status due to domestic violence; submitted evidence on lack of effective state protection in Costa Rica
Decision_Outcome: RPD dismissed claim, citing presumed state protection without addressing evidence
Remedy_Requested: Judicial review to challenge RPD decision
Court_Ruling: Application granted; case remitted for reconsideration
Defendant_Behavior: RPD failed to engage with critical evidence on state response to domestic violence in Costa Rica
Grounds_for_Claim: Risk of persecution due to gender-based violence and lack of state protection
Legal_Standard: RPD must provide adequate reasons when rejecting central evidence
Assessment_Factor: Effectiveness of police and judicial response to domestic violence in Costa Rica
Applicable_Legislation: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, Section 96 and Section 97
Procedural_Issue: Failure to properly analyze and explain rejection of key evidence
Evidence_Used: Documentary evidence on systemic deficiencies in protection for domestic violence victims in Costa Rica
Application_Basis: Well-founded fear of persecution on grounds of membership in a particular social group (women in Costa Rica who are victims of domestic violence)
Evidence_Assessed: State protection mechanisms for domestic violence victims in Costa Rica
Relief_Sought: Recognition as a Convention refugee and protection from removal
Governing_Rule: The RPD must adequately explain its reasoning when disregarding critical evidence on central issues
Evidentiary_Deficiency: RPD did not address or justify dismissal of evidence on lack of state protection
Outcome: Judicial review allowed; decision set aside; matter remitted to RPD
Harm_Assessment: Risk of continued domestic violence and lack of state protection if returned to Costa Rica
Cause_Description: Denial of refugee status based on assumption of effective state protection despite evidence to the contrary
Evidence_Handling: RPD failed to properly consider or explain dismissal of key evidence
Evidence_Issues: Failure to address credibility or weight of evidence on country conditions
Evidence_Assessment: Insufficient assessment of evidence regarding state protection
Decision_Rationale: RPD's decision was unreasonable due to inadequate reasoning on a central issue
Evidentiary_Issues: Lack of engagement with documentary evidence on domestic violence and state response
